citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A written itinerary was not submitted by the licensee prior to exhibition with overnight travel. The licensee was in a travel
status at the time of inspection, and no itinerary was available or submitted for overnight travel. Failure to provide an
itinerary prevents inspectors from conducting inspections to ensure the welfare of the animals covered under the Animal
Welfare Act. A written itinerary shall be submitted no fewer than 48 hours in advance of any travel and shall contain
complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at a location other
than the approved site. Correct by 8 September 2023.

The facility does not have a complete written plan to provide humane care for handling animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster. A written plan shall be developed, maintained and available for review by APHIS officials to
provide guidance for the appropriate care of the animals during emergencies that could reasonably be anticipated. The
plan shall address specific tasks required to be carried out in response to the identified emergencies, personnel
responsible for the actions to be taken, chain of command, etc., as required in Section 2.134 of the animal welfare
regulations. Correct by 15 September 2023.

A female terrier, “Marilyn” is not being provided the minimum floor space as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The
enclosure measures approximately 28 inches x 21.5 inches and provides a total of 602 sq. inches of space. The dog
measures 23 inches from the base of the tail to the tip of the nose and requires a minimum of 841 sq. inches of space.
Failing to provide adequate space can cause discomfort, stress, and contribute to poor sanitation. At the time of
inspection, the facility moved the dog to a larger enclosure. Correct by 8 September 2023 ensuring that all dogs are
provided with the minimum space required by the Animal Welfare Act.
.

Five dogs are not being provided the minimum interior height as required by the Animal Welfare Act. Each dog only
between 2-4 inches of clearance between the top of their head and the top of the enclosure when standing in a normal
position. All dogs require a minimum of 6 inches of clearance above the top of their heads. Failing to provide adequate
head space in a primary enclosure prevents normal postural adjustments, including stretching the neck up and can lead to
discomfort and potential developmental abnormalities. Correct by 15 September 2023 by ensuring that all dogs are
provided with the minimum interior height as required by the Animal Welfare Act.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
The inspection was conducted at the Chesterfield County Fair in Chesterfield, VA. The inspector did not watch the show.
n

narrative:
2.126(c) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A written itinerary was not submitted by the licensee prior to exhibition with overnight travel. The licensee was in a travel 
status at the time of inspection, and no itinerary was available or submitted for overnight travel. Failure to provide an 
itinerary prevents inspectors from conducting inspections to ensure the welfare of the animals covered under the Animal 
Welfare Act. A written itinerary shall be submitted no fewer than 48 hours in advance of any travel and shall contain 
complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at a location other 
than the approved site. Correct by 8 September 2023. 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility does not have a complete written plan to provide humane care for handling animals in the event of an 
emergency or disaster. A written plan shall be developed, maintained and available for review by APHIS officials to 
provide guidance for the appropriate care of the animals during emergencies that could reasonably be anticipated. The 
plan shall address specific tasks required to be carried out in response to the identified emergencies, personnel 
responsible for the actions to be taken, chain of command, etc., as required in Section 2.134 of the animal welfare 
regulations. Correct by 15 September 2023. 
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A female terrier, “Marilyn” is not being provided the minimum floor space as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The 
enclosure measures approximately 28 inches x 21.5 inches and provides a total of 602 sq. inches of space. The dog 
measures 23 inches from the base of the tail to the tip of the nose and requires a minimum of 841 sq. inches of space. 
Failing to provide adequate space can cause discomfort, stress, and contribute to poor sanitation. At the time of 
inspection, the facility moved the dog to a larger enclosure. Correct by 8 September 2023 ensuring that all dogs are 
provided with the minimum space required by the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
 
.

3.6(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Five dogs are not being provided the minimum interior height as required by the Animal Welfare Act. Each dog only 
between 2-4 inches of clearance between the top of their head and the top of the enclosure when standing in a normal 
position. All dogs require a minimum of 6 inches of clearance above the top of their heads. Failing to provide adequate 
head space in a primary enclosure prevents normal postural adjustments, including stretching the neck up and can lead to 
discomfort and potential developmental abnormalities. Correct by 15 September 2023 by ensuring that all dogs are 
provided with the minimum interior height as required by the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
The inspection was conducted at the Chesterfield County Fair in Chesterfield, VA. The inspector did not watch the show. 
 
 n
